title: Strange 'copy package'
description: When performing the 'copy package' operation in the 'Package Viewer' in the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' plugin, I encountered a strange behavior. After selecting a package and choosing 'copy' from the context menu, the package 'ui' was erroneously included in the destination project. This behavior was observed in project 'xxx'.
OB: After performing the 'copy package' operation, the package 'ui' was copied to the destination project 'xxx'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new project (e.g. 'xxx2').
2. Open the 'Package Viewer'.
3. Select a package in project 'A'.
4. From the context menu, choose 'copy'.
5. Verify that the package 'ui' is not included in the copied package in the destination project 'xxx2'.
